titleStmt.title: T-S K6.15
titleStmt.funder: The digitisation of the Taylor-Schechter Cairo Genizah Collection has been sponsored by the Jewish Manuscript Preservation Society, the Friedberg Genizah Project Inc., and the Arts and Humanities Research Council, UK.

msContents.summary: The first side (P2 f. 1r) contains two piyyuṭim of the rahaṭ type: עלי חוסה אלהי חסדי and צמאים לישעך (vocalised predominantly according to Tiberian norms, but with frequent replacement of pataḥ by segol). The next three sides (in a different hand to the first) contain a rhyming birkat ha-mazon for Passover. At the end of this text a name is written, the first part of which has been blacked out: [...b]en Yešuʿa ha-Baḥur. The final four sides contain (in a third hand), a grammatical treatise in Judaeo-Arabic on the beged-kefet and ʿwyh consonants, which is related to Hidāyat al-Qāriʾ by Abū l-Faraj Hārūn but does not correspond to any published version (Hebrew citations are vocalised and cantillated according to the Tiberian system; some spellings are non-standard, such as דתחי‫ק‬ and דפשי‫ק‬). A fourth hand wrote the name Yešuʿa b. Ḥalfon ha-Levi and copied a part of Deuteronomy 15:1 between the lines of P2 f. 2v.

msItem.title: Piyyuṭ; benediction; grammar; picture
msItem.textLang: Judaeo-Arabic; Hebrew (Tiberian vocalisation and cantillation); Arabic
msItem.note: The two bifolia form adjacent sheets from the same quire, possibly the central two sheets (P1 f. 2v contains the end of one text, and P1 f. 1r contains the beginning of a new text. Possibly, therefore, this was the central opening of the quire, unless an additional text was contained in - now lost - intervening sheet(s)). The text runs from: P2 f. 1r-v; P1 f. 2r-v; P1 f. 1r-v; P2 f. 2r-v. P1 f. 1v contain a few words in Arabic script (line 9). At the end of the birkat ha-mazon (P1 f. 2v) a geometric pattern and a candelabra have been drawn.

history.provenance: Donated by Dr Solomon Schechter and his patron Dr Charles Taylor in 1898 as part of the Taylor-Schechter Genizah Collection

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card for admissions procedures contact Cambridge University Library Admissions).
